channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: To save its unique and rare birds, New Zealand is turning to AI and genetic research
item.description: New Zealand is planning to eradicate millions of invasive animals that prey on the country's rare birds. The goal may not be possible, unless new tech...

item.title: UC Berkeley professor warns of 'unprecedented crackdown' on academic freedom
item.description: UC Berkeley told 160 faculty, staff and students that their names were included in files shared with the federal government related to "alleged antise...

item.title: Trump wraps up state visit to U.K.
item.description: After a day of royal pomp, President Trump's visit to the United Kingdom closes with a business reception and a meeting with Prime Minister Keir Starm...

item.title: Trump says he disagrees with Starmer's decision to recognize Palestinian state
item.description: President Trump and British Prime Minister Keir Starmer talked about foreign affairs privately for about an hour, including the conflicts in Gaza and ...

item.title: How CDC's vaccine advisers could affect policy. And, Jimmy Kimmel pulled off the air
item.description: CDC vaccine advisers meet today to discuss recommendations for COVID vaccines and childhood shots. And, ABC suspends Jimmy Kimmel's late-night show af...

item.title: 'Cataclysmic' situation in Gaza City, UN official says, as Israeli tanks advance
item.description: A constant of stream of Palestinians flee southwards as Israeli tanks reportedly push further into Gaza's biggest urban centre.

item.title: Hurricane Helene displaced thousands of students. Some struggled to get back on track with school
RFK Jr. announces move to decertify organ procurement organization
item.description: HHS Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr. announced a move to decertify an organ procurement organization and steps to reform the organ donation system.

item.title: Egypt says 3,000-year-old bracelet was stolen and melted down
item.description: A specialist took the gold artefact from a Cairo museum and sold it through a jeweller, officials say.

item.title: Trump says Putin has "really let me down" as he wraps up U.K. visit
item.description: Trump's visit to Britain moved from royal spectacle to politics on day 2, as he and the U.K.'s Keir Starmer discussed the Gaza and Ukraine wars and ot...

item.title: Judge blocks deportation of Guatemalan kids, saying justification "crumbled"
item.description: Judge Timothy Kelly wrote that the administration's argument that it was trying to reunite a group of Guatemalan kids with family members "crumbled li...

item.title: Malawi's parties warned not to prematurely declare election victory
item.description: The parties of both President Lazarus Chakwera and his main rival, Peter Mutharika, say they won Tuesday's poll.

item.title: Royals, Maga and tech CEOs: What we learned from state banquet guest list
item.description: The event is as much about diplomacy as it is about fine dining.

item.title: Workers across France strike over budget cut plans
item.description: The widespread walkouts come less than a fortnight after the government collapsed over a proposed budget.

item.title: Watch: Trump and Starmer discuss Putin distrust, free speech and Israeli hostages
item.description: President Trump and British Prime Minister Keir Starmer took questions on several topics Thursday, including the Israel-Hamas war, free speech in the ...

item.title: Spirit Airlines to cut capacity by 25% this fall, hints at layoffs
item.description: Capacity cuts "will inevitably affect the size of our teams," Spirit Airlines CEO Dave Davis said in a memo to employees.

item.title: Shooting kills 3 officers and wounds 2 more in rural Pennsylvania. Police say the shooter is dead
item.description: Authorities have been investigating a shooting that killed three officers and wounded two more in rural southern Pennsylvania.

item.title: Suspect in Charlie Kirk killing feared being shot by police before surrendering, sheriff says
